text: I’m remodeling my office and i’m going to be doing some cool things to my office / desk space — I’m curious what are your favorite things at your desk / office that you would recommend for someone looking to upgrade their gear!

I’ve got some led light strips i’m going to put under my desks for some lighting and I think i’m going to get a monitor riser so that I can hide my widescreen monitor under my desk so I can see out the window behind it when i’m not using it
sit and stand desk for sure

I see that the images in the blog posts have an option to add lazy loading now. But all my old blog posts dont have that setting and its a lot of work to go back and add that setting to each of the images in the blog. Is there a way to activate it globally so it would lazy load ALL the images in the portal, also the Image CTAs?
Good docking setup for your laptop is nice to have as well

<@U7SL518D6> I’m going to be making some custom desks so I think I’m going to use a pull out adjustable swivel seat, that way it stays as a stand up, but I can use a seat that kinda pulls out and lets me still keep it at that height. Because the desk is going to be a corner and i’m planning on doing a live edge / epoxy type river that is lit up, I just don’t want to keep moving it just in case
you have a good dock <@U54TVT3C1> you use for the mac?

Nick that sounds super cool. Had no idea you were into woodworking/epoxy, or are ya purchasing it?

Either way would love to see pics of the set up when you get it done.
<@U25PYL3Q8> I currently have a kinda crappy solution but was thinking about a belkin thunderbolt 3.  Just anything where you can have a single cable to connect to everything.
<@U54TVT3C1> a single cable would be nice, then I could swap out my two mac laptops with no effort!

<@U7SL518D6> I’ll def share. this remodel has been going on since before covid started. Just got the drywall up, so i am really done “dreaming” and going to start “doing”

I like doing woodwork stuff and things like that. I haven’t done any epoxy myself, but my brother in law is a contractor and my dad used to make high end furniture a long long time ago.. so they are going to help me out with this stuff and make sure I don’t mess anything up too much.

Super cool. My wife’s more of the woodworker/shop expert, but her and I collabed on a gift for my dad who loves cribbage.

CNC’d the track, poured epoxy resin with some glittery gold colored flecks, laser engraved the name, and then CNC’d again theholes in the epoxy and wood for the peggs. Also drilled a hole in the board to store the pegs inside. Project took a long while, and honestly all credit goes to my wife for being the smart one on it.

That’s about as close as I’ve ever done to what you’re doing. The epoxy was the first time both my wife and I ever did it.
That looks really great! Im very proud of yall. Looks super detailed.

If you guys havent done epoxy, highly recommend talking to someone who has a lot. There's more to it than i expected. One thing i wish id have known was - minimize having to sand the epoxy at all.

We didnt do a great job with that so the epoxy turned out cloudier looking than we wanted (basically the heat caused by sanding it caused it)
Have you tried buffing it down?
yeah, didn’t have much success with that.

I think i’ve watched about 150 hours of river table creation from various content providers. I also am reaching out to theperson that did our “granite-concrete” which is really epoxy countertops in our kitchen… and he is going to supervise and get a consulting fee as well
Here is a quick video of the countertops he built
wow that is beautiful work. Also lol loved your kiddo and response. “no you’re okay you can do whatever”
He is trying to break a plastic cup to get his lollipop out
I’m like I can’t look at you break this lol. OH WELL. Yes, this guy did our kitchen right counters 4 1/2 years ago and they have just been amazing

I have a Stream Deck and love it.

Use it for shortcuts, macros, code snippets, zoom. All kinds of things
